Title: First Time Sex (no this does not involve my first
Content:
A girl asks her boyfriend to come over Friday night to meet, and have a dinner with her parents.

Since this is such a big event, the girl announces to her boyfriend that after dinner, she would like to go out and make love for the first time.  
The boy is ecstatic, but he has never had sex before, so he takes a trip to the pharmacist to get some condoms. He tells the  pharmacist it‚Äôs his first time and the pharmacist helps the boy for about an hour. He tells the boy everything there is to know about condoms and sex.

At the register, the pharmacist asks the boy how many condoms he‚Äôd like to buy, a 3-pack, 10-pack, or family pack.
The boy insists on the family pack because he thinks he will be rather busy, it being his first time and all.
That night, the boy shows up at the girl‚Äôs parents house and meets his girlfriend at the door.
‚ÄúOh, I‚Äôm so excited for you to meet my parents, come on in!‚Äù
The boy goes inside and is taken to the dinner table where the girl‚Äôs parents are seated.
The boy quickly offers to say grace and bows his head. A minute passes, and the boy is still deep in prayer, with his head down.

10 minutes pass, and still no movement from the boy.
Finally, after 20 minutes with his head down, the girlfriend leans over and whispers to the boyfriend, ‚ÄòI had no idea you were this religious.‚Äô

The boy turns, and whispers back,
‚ÄòI had no idea your father was a pharmacist

Title: Dagnabit‚Äôs story (a dog)
Content:
Kim first met Dagnabit in 2004, when he was found wandering behind one of her businesses. She said he looked as if he had scars. He had aggression toward other dogs, and his ears had been cut off.
Dagnabit had a collar with a phone number for a veterinarian in Florida, but his owner could not be found. One of Kim‚Äôs employees decided to take care of Dagnabit.

Slowly, Dagnabit got used to other dogs, and his aggression eased. His owner found him sitting cross-legged on the floor one day, and called Kim for help. A trip to the veterinarian‚Äôs office resulted in bad news¬óDagnabit needed life-saving surgery for three ruptured discs in his back.
Three months after the surgery, Dagnabit had lost 30 pounds and could not walk. Kim says he acted as if he had lost his spirit, but she would visit him every day at the boarding clinic where he was being kept. Kim later became Dagnabit‚Äôs official owner.

Having worked as a rehabilitation counselor for children, Kim decided to try similar rehabilitation principles on Dagnabit. The two worked with a canine massage practitioner, a veterinarian acupuncturist, and a veterinarian specializing in chiropractic and homeopathic medicine. Soon after, Dagnabit was finally able to stand again.
Kim began taking classes at the University of Tennessee and became a Certified Canine Rehabilitation Practitioner. She began working with Doggone Wheels to produce a wheelchair for Dagnabit. It wasn‚Äôt long before he was wheeling around the French Quarter, and he even began to swim.
Kim continues to work with Doggone Wheels to help disabled dogs all over the country get fitted for wheelchairs. She started Dag‚Äôs House, a dog rehabilitation facility with a fitness center, canine hydrotherapy pool, agility course, and outdoor space dedicated to relaxation, play, endurance training, and conditioning.
The wheelchair was just the start for Dagnabit. He is now out of the wheelchair and is learning to walk again. He can even go up stairs. His aggression toward other dogs is completely gone.
‚ÄúHe is so strong-willed about doing it [walking up stairs],‚Äù said Kim. ‚ÄúHe trusts me. He‚Äôs amazing. He‚Äôs like the poster child for disabled dogs¬óhe‚Äôs beat all odds.
‚ÄúHe has changed my life,‚Äù said Kim. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs an amazing dog.‚Äù
About the fundraising winner
The photo that won the grand prize for the Fundraisers Category raised more than $32,000 for Romania Animal Rescue. The photo was submitted by Dr. Aurelian Stefan, a veterinarian at the Romania Animal Rescue.
Ciao, the dog in the photo, was named after the gas station where he was found (and means both ‚Äúhello‚Äù and ‚Äúgoodbye‚Äù in Italian). Dr. Stefan brought him to the clinic, but Ciao died shortly thereafter.
‚ÄúHello and goodbye are the words that all the gas station dogs hear many times a day,‚Äù said Dr. Stefan. ‚ÄúThey have a cruel life because they live along the busy roads with all the dangers that a busy road brings. I wanted Ciao to speak out on behalf of the homeless dogs living along the highways. They need a home, or at least to be spayed and neutered.‚Äù
Dr. Stefan emailed and messaged friends on Facebook to drum up votes for Ciao.
Romania Animal Rescue Inc. is a 501(c)3 charity with headquarters in California. It is also a registered charity in Romania. Romania Animal Rescue does not have a shelter in Romania, but funds free spay/neuter for shelters, as well as doing ‚Äúspayathons‚Äù in villages and cities. The clinic has a regular set of clients that bring in street dogs to Dr. Stefan and his brother, Petrisor Stefan, who do spay/neuter and emergency treatments in Romania.

Title: Buyer beware: puppy scams online
Content:
As more and more Americans turn to the Web to find the pet of their dreams, scams have skyrocketed as criminals seek to take advantage of unsuspecting pet parents. According to the Internet Crime Complaint Center, hundreds of complaints are filed each year by victims who were conned when attempting to buy a dog online.
One potential pet parent, Diane, was hoping to add a Yorkshire Terrier puppy to her family when she spotted a classified ad in her local paper. ¬ìIt was over my morning coffee that I saw the perfect ad for a Yorkie named Nancy,¬î says Diane, who lives near Cleveland, OH. She sent an email to the address listed, and immediately received a response¬óDiane could have the puppy if she promised her a loving home and sent $500 to cover the shipping fees.
¬ìI corresponded for an entire week with this man who claimed to be a missionary,¬î Diane explains. Diane sent the requested payment via Western Union, but once she sent the code for the money transfer, she never heard from the ¬ìpastor¬î again.
Like many trusting animal lovers, Diane fell victim to one of many ¬ìfree to good home¬î scams currently circulating the Internet and classified sections of newspapers. So how do you avoid persuasive cons and still get the dog of your dreams? The ASPCA recommends never buying a dog you haven¬ít met in person and always check references. Also, keep in mind that adoption is still the best option, even if you have your heart set on a purebred dog. There are thousands of dogs waiting for good homes at local animal shelters, including purebreds! Please help others avoid being cheated by emailing your puppy scam story to dogstory@aspca.org.

Title: Ladies night out/Bear update
Content:
Well last night was our Ladie‚Äôs Night at Shooters bar inside a bowling alley. We went up to this one part that had pool tables and darts and a jukebox and hung out up there. My friend Ginny and April from school came and Belinda and Ginny‚Äôs friend Lauren. Ginny and April and Lauren were a little tipsy lol but it was still fun. I just wish the other girls we invited could actually come. Next month‚Äôs event is gonna be either chick flick movie night or a picnic potluck if the weather is nice enough by that time. 
Bear was doing better but is still having issues. He eats but still barely drinks and doesn‚Äôt seem to have energy like he did before. So we took him to the vet today and the vet drew blood. So hopefully we find out what is going on so we can make him better and it‚Äôs nothing serious or life-threatening.
Kacey is doing better since we put him on a 2nd dose of his medication for the afternoon. He still gets a little too excited and gets in trouble but only at home. The weather is actually getting nice out with a few chilly days here and there. Tuesday is my first day of class. I have 3 classes. Psychology which is online and then Culture and Diversity and principles of vet profession. One is tues and thurs and the other is weds and thurs. For last quarter I got perfect attendance and a 4.0 grade point average but I‚Äôm confused because I also got perfect attendance for the quarter before this one but they told me because I was only half time that I was basically not eligible and I was half time this quarter but got a certificate. WHO KNOWS LOL. 
Me and some people in my classes were discussing the whole deal with some of the classes we have to take. Some of them don‚Äôt make sense for the vet tech program. We have to take career skills, human relations, speech, culture and diversity. Can someone please tell me what those have to do with animals lol. I get the whole deal with having to deal with the owners of the animals but what do they have to do with the animals. So anyway that is my update of sorts for now. Marjorie is still driving me crazy lol. I have a review coming up in April just not sure exactly when so it should be interesting to see what she has to say about me. Being late will probably be a big one and not helping her put her walker in my car will probably be another one. The only reaosn I don‚Äôt help her with her walker is because she goes to her side of the car. What is the point of me getting out of the car walking all the way around just to put it in when she could just do it herself. The walker is not that heavy to lift. If it was something that was heavy I would definitely help.

Title: Is someone really this dumb
Content:
Ok I try very hard not to talk about my friends and what they do with their lives because it‚Äôs their lives and their choices but there is one that REALLY bothers me right now. My friend Melisa D is pregnant. Her first baby who was a girl was a month premature. She was put in the hospital with contractions not long ago and told to be on bedrest so what is doing? Well let‚Äôs see walking around the mall and planning on going to Kansas City, KS. Is she mental or really wants to have another premature baby. It just makes me mad to know that someone would be that careless about their unborn baby to endanger it by going against her doctor‚Äôs orders. Of course I‚Äôm not gonna tell her this because she would get pissed off at me and tell me to mind my business so I figure if I vent on here and get it out then maybe it won‚Äôt bother me that much.
She got ticked off at me before because I basically told her I don‚Äôt care for her bf but her family doesn‚Äôt like him or didn‚Äôt like him. Now all of a sudden they jumped on his bandwagon. Confused. We invited them over for Thanksgiving dinner. Well her daughter was screaming and crying and he was just sitting there playing on his phone. We were passing her around trying to get her to stop crying while he sat there and did nothing. I explained why I didn‚Äôt care for him and she made the excuse ‚Äúoh he‚Äôs impatient.‚Äù HELLO he has kids he is gonna have to learn how to be patient or he‚Äôs gonna be screwed. Then she kept saying how he keeps accusing her of cheating on him because he works in Chicago as a cab driver while she‚Äôs at home raising their kids by herself which she claims she likes so more power to her with that one. But why would you date someone who keeps accusing you of cheating? Some people baffle me. 
Sorry for the bitching and moaning I just needed to get that out so I didn‚Äôt accidentally blow up at her. Again I know I shouldn‚Äôt be butting into people‚Äôs business and this time I didn‚Äôt say a word to her about this situation. It‚Äôs her life and she can do what she wants but it doesn‚Äôt mean it doesn‚Äôt bug the hell out of me lol.

Title: GOD WHAT A SHITTY DAY
Content:
Do you just have one of those sucky days where you wish you could just stay in bed all day. That was my day today or at least the beginning of my day was like that. I had to work today and I actually got to Marjorie‚Äôs house before she had to be at her appointment lol. So I dropped her off at her appointment and went back home for a while because her appointment was gonna take a hour. So I went home and started doing some chores and stuff but forgot my phone in my van and I was about to leave to go get her but I had to take a crap (sorry I know TMI) So when I got in the car I called her to let her know I was on my way so she was ticked because I made her wait 20 minutes. So I get to the place to pick her up and she asks me if I got her meds to which I said no because she didn‚Äôt say anything to me about getting them to which she got mad about and told me YES she did tell me that so I just let it be and went over to get her meds. You would tell she would have realized that she obviously didn‚Äôt tell me because she never gave me the money to go get them DUH. So anyway we start going and I ask where we are going and she says I told you before Wal-mart so I just said OK because she didn‚Äôt say a thing about going to wal-mart or else I wouldn‚Äôt have asked her where we were going. So I was so glad to drop her off. 

So then me and my mom were out running her errands. I was turning into a parking lot from the main road and there was a teenager who wasn‚Äôt paying attention so I was waiting for him to figure out whether he was gonna keep walking across the street or stop and I heard squeeching brakes behind me. Luckily the person didn‚Äôt hit our van but did scare the shit out of all of us. Nice weather = maniacs on the roads.
So that was my interesting day. It wasn‚Äôt totally horrible because the weather was awesome out and school wasn‚Äôt that bad. I‚Äôm so glad to be getting a 4 day vacation of sorts from work. I NEED IT. She‚Äôs about to drive me crazy.

Title: Teens find dead body at egg hunt
Content:
DES MOINES, Iowa ‚Äì Police say two teenagers who wandered away from their younger siblings at an Easter egg hunt have found a body at a Des Moines park. 
Police Sgt. Chris Scott says the teens came across the man‚Äôs body in a wooded area at Beaverdale Park on Saturday morning. 
He says the teens had accompanied their siblings to the park‚Äôs egg hunt but wandered away. The body was found at least 300 yards from where the egg hunt took place. He didn‚Äôt know how old the teens were. 
About 100 children participated in the annual event. 
Police say they don‚Äôt suspect any foul play, and an autopsy is planned. 
The man‚Äôs name hasn‚Äôt been released pending notification of his family.

Title: drunk man has to call police to get out of bar
Content:
LEXINGTON, Ky. (AP) ‚Äì Drunk in a bar and can‚Äôt get out, who you gonna call? Police. That‚Äôs what Todd Fitzwater did in Lexington. WLEX-TV reported Fitzwater called 911 Thursday and said he‚Äôd gotten drunk and passed out at Todd‚Äôs Karaoke Bar the night before, awakened and had a few more ‚Äì then couldn‚Äôt get out of the bar, which was closed.
Officers tapped on the door Thursday afternoon to guide the 45-year-old Fitzwater to it so he could let them in to help him.
The bar owner said Fitzwater is a ‚Äúregular‚Äù who lives nearby. The barkeep stayed with him until 7:30 a.m. Thursday, then left figuring Fitzwater would eventually let himself out and go home.
___
Information from: WLEX-TV, http://www.wlextv.com

Title: 12 yr old arrested for doodling on desk
Content:
NEW YORK ¬ó A 12-year-old girl who was hauled out of her New York City school in handcuffs for doodling on her desk has started legal action against the city over her arrest.
A lawyer for Alexa Gonzalez filed legal papers seeking $1 million in damages, saying the Queens girl was subjected to overly harsh treatment.
Alexa was arrested at her junior high school in February after scribbling ‚ÄúI love my friends Abby and Faith‚Äù on her desk with an erasable marker.
Her family‚Äôs lawyer says school officials overreacted by calling the police.
The Department of Education acknowledges the arrest was a mistake. The city‚Äôs legal department has declined to comment on the lawsuit.
Information from: Daily News, http://www.nydailynews.com

Title: satellite dish
Content:
Well my dog Bear was appearing to get better from his infection issue he has but the bad thing is it now looks as if he is getting a bad infection in his feet. So far two of them are very bad and the other two are starting to have problems. So we took him to the vet to find this out and the doc said he might lose his toes because the infection he has is a serious one that is hard to fight off so we have to soak each paw in a diluted betadine solution for 5 minutes and he has to have another ‚Äúsateline dish‚Äù or ‚Äúlamp shade‚Äù collar on so he doesn‚Äôt basically chew off his feet. He goes back tomorrow for a recheck . hopefully they have improved. 
Other than that Easter went well. The weather at least stayed decent for most of the day. It started raining towards sunset and even had a few thunderstorms. Friday we had a Easter Egg hunt with Anna and Kacey. They had a ball collecting close to 500 eggs. So I guess that is my update for now.

Title: When is enough enough
Content:
This event is being held in memory of 11-year-old Carl Joseph Walker-Hoover, one of many beautiful lives cut tragically short because of bullying. Carl took his own life on April 6, 2009 after enduring constant bullying, including being called ‚Äúgay‚Äù and ‚Äúfaggot‚Äù despite not even identifying as gay.
Please spend 5 minutes in Carl‚Äôs memory and CALL YOUR Representative and ask him/her to support (or thank them if they already do) the Safe Schools Improvement Act, a comprehensive federal anti-bullying bill.
If you don‚Äôt feel comfortable calling your Rep, consider spending 5 minutes in some other way to remember Carl and raise awareness about bullying.
You can also sign a petition in support of the Safe Schools Improvement Act in memory of Carl at http://bit.ly/Sign4Carl
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
FIND YOUR Congressperson here: http://bit.ly/ForCarl
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
I find this scenario becoming more and more daily. It‚Äôs sad to know that these kids are actually killing themselves because they feel it‚Äôs the only way out. Why aren‚Äôt the schools doing more to stop these kids that do the bullying? Suspend them, make them volunteer somewhere something. I was bullied all through my school years and it sucked then but now it seems like the bullies have more tools to do it. Now they have text messages, the net, facebook, myspace and so much more stuff to humiliate their victims. It‚Äôs sad. I really hope we can find an end to this very stupid thing and learn that everyone is different but that they shouldn‚Äôt be made fun of for it. I‚Äôm not perfect but I try my best to be friends with people who are different than me whether they are biracial, heavyset, single moms, married, divorced, lesbians, bi. To me it doesn‚Äôt make a difference on the outside it‚Äôs their personalities that draw me to them. I just wish more people thought like that and didn‚Äôt judge people because they don‚Äôt have designer clothes or heavyset or lesbian or gay or black or biracial. Why should it matter?

Title: What my Mother taught me
Content:
1.  My mother taught me TO APPRECIATE A JOB WELL DONE .
    ‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre going to kill each other, do  it outside.. I just finished cleaning.‚Äù
    2. My mother taught me RELIGION.  
    ‚ÄúYou better pray that will come out of the carpet..‚Äù
    3.  My mother taught me about TIME TRAVEL.
    ‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt straighten up, I‚Äôm going to knock you into the middle of next week!‚Äù

    4. My mother taught me LOGIC.
    ‚Äù  Because I said so, that‚Äôs why.‚Äù
    5. My mother taught me MORE LOGIC .  
    ‚ÄúIf you fall out of that swing and break your neck, you‚Äôre not going to the store with me.‚Äù
    6. My mother taught me FORESIGHT.
    ‚ÄúMake sure you wear clean  underwear, in case you‚Äôre in an accident.‚Äù
    7. My mother taught me IRONY.  
    ‚ÄúKeep crying, and I‚Äôll give you something to cry about.‚Äù
    8.  My mother taught me about the science of OSMOSIS .
    ‚ÄúShut your mouth and eat your supper.‚Äù
    9. My mother taught me about CONTORTIONISM.
    ‚ÄúWill you look at that dirt on the back of your neck!‚Äù
    10. My mother taught me about STAMINA  .
    ‚ÄúYou‚Äôll sit there until all that spinach is gone.‚Äù
    11.  My mother taught me about WEATHER.
    ‚ÄúThis room of yours looks as if a tornado went through it‚Äù
    12. My mother taught me about HYPOCRISY.
    ‚ÄúIf I told you once, I‚Äôve told you a million times. Don‚Äôt exaggerate!‚Äù
    13. My mother taught me the CIRCLE OF LIFE.
    ‚ÄúI brought you into this world, and I can take you out..‚Äù
    14. My mother taught me about BEHAVIOR MODIFICATION .
    ‚ÄúStop acting  like your father!‚Äù
    15 My mother taught me about ENVY.
    ‚ÄúThere are millions of less fortunate children in this world who don‚Äôt have wonderful parents like you do.‚Äù
    16. My mother taught me about ANTICIPATION.
    ‚ÄúJust wait until we get  home.‚Äù
    17. My mother taught me about RECEIVING .
    ‚ÄúYou are going to get it when you  get home!‚Äù
    18. My mother taught me MEDICAL SCIENCE.
    ‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt stop crossing  your eyes, they are going to get stuck that way.‚Äù
    19. My mother taught me ESP.
    ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt like that look, I know what you‚Äôre thinking?‚Äù
    20.  My mother taught me HUMOR.
    ‚ÄúWhen that lawn mower cuts off your toes, don‚Äôt  come running to me.‚Äù
    21. My mother taught me HOW TO BECOME AN ADULT .
    ‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt  eat your vegetables, you‚Äôll never grow up.‚Äù
    22. My mother taught me GENETICS.  
    ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre just like your father.‚Äù
    23 My mother taught me about my  ROOTS.
    ‚ÄúShut that door‚Ä¶ were born in a barn?‚Äù
    24. My mother taught me WISDOM.  
    ‚ÄúWhen you get to be my age, you‚Äôll understand..‚Äù
    And the best one:  
    25.  My mother taught me about JUSTICE  .
    ‚ÄúOne day you‚Äôll have kids, and I hope they turn out just like you !‚Äù

Title: For Grandparents
Content:
1. She was in the bathroom, putting on her makeup, under the watchful eyes of her young granddaughter, as she‚Äôd done many times before. After she applied her lipstick and started to leave, the little one said, ‚ÄúBut Gramma, you forgot to kiss the toilet paper good-bye!‚Äù I will probably never put lipstick on again without thinking about kissing the toilet paper good-bye‚Ä¶

    2. My young grandson called the other day to wish me Happy Birthday. He asked me how old I was, and I told him, 62.  My grandson was quiet for a moment, and then he asked,  ‚ÄúDid you start at 1?‚Äù

    3. After putting her grandchildren to bed, a grandmother changed into old slacks and a droopy blouse and proceeded to wash her hair.. As she heard the children getting more and more rambunctious, her patience grew thin. Finally, she threw a towel around her head and stormed into their room,  putting them back to bed with stern warnings. As she left the room, she heard the three-year-old say with a trembling voice,
    ‚ÄúWho was THAT?‚Äù

    4. A grandmother was telling her little granddaughter what her own childhood was like: ‚ÄúWe used to skate outside on a pond I had a swing made from a tire; it hung from a tree in our front yard.. We rode our pony. We picked wild raspberries in the woods.‚Äù The little girl was wide-eyed,  taking this all in. At last she said, ‚ÄúI sure wish I‚Äôd gotten to know you sooner!‚Äù

    5. My grandson was visiting one day when he asked,
    ‚ÄúGrandma, do you know how you and God are alike?‚Äù I mentally polished my halo and I said, ‚ÄúNo, how are we alike?‚Äù ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre both old,‚Äù he replied.

    6. A little girl was diligently pounding away on her
    grandfather‚Äôs word processor. She told him she was
    writing a story. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äô s it about?‚Äù he asked.
    ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know,‚Äù she replied. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt read.‚Äù

    7. I didn‚Äôt know if my granddaughter had learned her
    colors yet, so I decided to test her. I would point out
    something and ask what color it was. She would tell me and was always correct. It was fun for me, so I continued. At last, she headed for the door, saying, ‚ÄúGrandma, I think you should try to figure out some of these, yourself!‚Äù

    8. When my grandson Billy and I entered our vacation cabin,  we kept the lights off until we were inside to keep from attracting pesky insects. Still, a few fireflies followed us in. Noticing them before I did, Billy whispered, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs no use Grandpa.  Now the mosquitoes are coming after us with flashlights.‚Äù

    9. When my grandson asked me how old I was, I teasingly replied, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure.‚Äù  ‚ÄúLook in your underwear, Grandpa,‚Äù he advised, ‚ÄúMine says
    I‚Äôm 4 to 6.‚Äù

    10. A second grader came home from school and said to her grandmother, ‚ÄúGrandma, guess what? We learned how to make babies today.‚Äù The grandmother, more than a little surprised, tried to keep her cool. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs interesting,‚Äù she said,  ‚Äúhow do you make babies?‚Äù  ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs simple,‚Äù replied the girl. ‚ÄúYou just change ‚Äòy‚Äô to ‚Äòi‚Äô and add ‚Äòes‚Äô.‚Äù

    11. Children‚Äôs Logic: ‚ÄúGive me a sentence about a
    public servant,‚Äù said a teacher. The small boy wrote:
    ‚ÄúThe fireman came down the ladder pregnant.‚Äù The
    teacher took the lad aside to correct him. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt
     you know what pregnant means?‚Äù she asked.
     ‚ÄúSure,‚Äù said the young boy confidently. ‚ÄúIt means
     carrying a child.‚Äù

    12. A grandfather was delivering his grandchildren to
    their home one day when a fire truck zoomed past.
    Sitting in the front seat of the fire truck was a Dalmatian dog.  The children started discussing the dog‚Äôs duties.
    ‚ÄúThey use him to keep crowds back,‚Äù said one child.
    ‚ÄúNo,‚Äù said another. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs just for good luck.‚Äù
     A third child brought the argument to a close.‚ÄùThey use the dogs,‚Äù she said firmly, ‚Äúto find the fire hydrants.‚Äù

    13. A 6-year-old was asked where his grandma lived.
    ‚ÄúOh,‚Äù he said, ‚ÄúShe lives at the airport, and when we want her, we just go get her. Then, when we‚Äôre done having her visit, we take her back to the airport.‚Äù

    14. Grandpa is the smartest man on earth! He teaches me good, good things, but I don‚Äôt get to see him enough to get as smart as him!

    15. My Grandparents are funny, when they bend over; you  hear gas leaks, and they blame their dog.

Title: R.I.P. Bear
Content: Well Thursday was a pretty crappy day for me. First off I was sick so of course that didn‚Äôt help me. Then my mom came upstairs in tears at like 5:30 in the morning saying there was something wrong with Bear and that she thought he was dead. So Jess went downstairs to see and unfortunately he was gone. So then we had to wrap him up and take him to the emergency clinic where they cremated him. We got a paw print that you bake which me and my mom did today. I‚Äôm also gonna make a collage photo and give it to my mom. My throat was hurting so bad I couldn‚Äôt really cry. It‚Äôs hard to have a dog since they were a puppy and then they pass away. I was hoping that he was gonna pull through it but I think the infection was just too strong for him. I remember one of his last days before he passed. He couldn‚Äôt figure out how to eat with his ‚Äúlampshade‚Äù on so I was sitting on the floor right next to him hand feeding him. Now that he‚Äôs gone it‚Äôs so hard to look at his toys still sitting in the box and know that my buddy isn‚Äôt around for me to play ball with or to go for car rides.

Title: It‚Äôs hard
Content:
It‚Äôs so hard to think of Bear being gone forever. I really really miss him. He was such a great dog and so darn smart. When I compare him to my other dogs they are so different. Coco is wonderful but very stubborn and lazy. She doesn‚Äôt like to play with toys but does love walks. Buck is hyper but doesn‚Äôt get the point of playing with toys either. That‚Äôs probably the biggest thing I miss about Bear. He always loved to play no matter what. Even right before he passed away he loved to play with his ball. Nothing would stop him lol. I remember a day or two before he passed he was upstairs and I was actually hand feeding him because I don‚Äôt think he could figure out how to get his lampshade over the food dish. My mom made the comment ‚ÄúBear I hope you don‚Äôt expect me to do this for you too.‚Äù lol 
School is going good but of course getting harder. The good thing is I have at least one class with my friends. We are planning a potluck picnic for Friday afternoon. Hopefully the weather cooperates and we don‚Äôt get the storms they claim we might. I just wish Tab could come sooner so she could meet my friends but I understand. Hopefully some time soon she will be able to meet them. 
Kacey is still doing well in school. He has his moments. Maybe it‚Äôs just me but his medication seems to make him more angry sometimes and prone to throwing tantrums so when the dr calls to refill his meds I‚Äôm gonna talk to her about that. 
Bowling is almost over lol. Work isn‚Äôt too bad lately. The lady I work admitted she was a lil depressed so maybe that was why she snapped at me.

Title: Cat gets free ride back home
Content:
CHICAGO (AP) ‚Äì No one knows how a tabby cat named Charles traveled the 1,300 miles from his New Mexico home to Chicago, but he‚Äôs set for a complimentary flight home on American Airlines in a carrier donated by an Albuquerque business.
Charles disappeared about eight months ago while his owner was out of town and a friend was caring for him.
‚ÄúOh, I was crushed, and I found out while I was away volunteering with Habitat for Humanity, and I was so upset because I was in New Orleans so there was nothing I could do,‚Äù said Robin Alex, of Albuquerque.
Then earlier this week, Alex received a call telling her Chicago Animal Care and Control had picked up her wandering cat as a stray. Staffers reached out to Alex after finding that Charles had a tracking microchip embedded between his shoulder blades, said the agency‚Äôs executive director, Cherie Travis.
But Alex said she could not afford the round-trip ticket to Chicago to bring Charles home, so she was afraid he might be euthanized.
Enter fellow Albuquerque resident Lucien Sims. Sims said he has a tabby cat who strongly resembles Charles, and was moved when his mother sent him an online story about Alex and her pet.
Most importantly, Sims was on his way to Chicago on Thursday for a wedding, so he said he would go to the shelter, pick up Charles and bring him back to New Mexico.
Sims has made all the arrangements for Charles‚Äô return, including getting a company to donate a cat carrier and American Airlines to waive the cat‚Äôs travel fee.
Travis said Charles is definitely ready for his next adventure.
‚ÄúHe‚Äôs in good condition,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúHe needs a good brushing. He‚Äôs got a little bit of a cold ‚Äì a little bit of an upper respiratory infection ‚Äì but otherwise he‚Äôs in great condition.‚Äù

Title: Why do Men have to fight?
Content:
Well today we put Coco our huskie Shepherd mix outside on a chain because she constantly wants to go outside but she HATES to be left outside by herself. She was out there for not even an hour. I left to go get Kacey from school. I come back and Jess let out Buck to go to the bathroom and this dude appears out near the sidewalk near our driveway. He then says ‚Äúwhen are you gonna fu*king shut your dog up I‚Äôm trying to sleep.‚Äù So Jess says there is no noise ordinance for during the day and it wasn‚Äôt like Coco was out there all day constantly barking and Coco isn‚Äôt the only dog in the neighborhood who barks. So the dude then says ‚Äúwell you better shut it up or I‚Äôm gonna call the cops on you guys.‚Äù So Jess said ‚Äúgo ahead.‚Äù Then the dude says ‚Äù or I‚Äôll kill your dog.‚Äù That pissed Jess off and he called the dude a b*tch  so then the guy starts doing the macho thing saying don‚Äôt be calling me a b*tch and if you‚Äôre so manly come over here and do something about it. So Jess goes over near where the guy lives and gets in his face, didn‚Äôt touch him but got in his face so the other guy pushes Jess so he pushes back and they end up on the ground wrestling around. Jess puts the guy in a chokehold basically and they finally stop and go their separate ways. While they were wrestling I called the cops. The cops eventually showed up like an hour later and by that time everything was calm. All this crap could have been avoided if the guy would have just come over and knocked on our door and asked us if we could keep it down because he slept during the day. HOW FUCKING HARD IS THAT? If he didn‚Äôt want to deal with  us he could have called the police and made a complaint or called animal control and had them come over. At least the guy didn‚Äôt have a weapon and neither one of them got hurt. I really laid into Jess about it because he did this shit while Kacey was standing there watching. 
On to other news our picnic went quite well. Everyone showed up. The only bad thing was my friend Mandy came and brought her stuff but then they left and never came back lol. Now we got to think of what to do for the month of May. We‚Äôll figure something out. We had to watch a Oprah show about Puppy Mills today in my animal office principles class. It was very sad and made me so angry at the same time. They also talked about having to euthansize animals which I could NEVER do unless they were sick. Our teacher for that class is a actual vet tech and she used to work at the county animal services and she was talking about how she had to put kittens who were very sick to sleep and how they would be purring and rubbing against her. I could never do that job. I would come home in tears every day. Well that‚Äôs my update of sorts.

Title: not much going on
Content:
Well not much going on in my neck of the woods but figured I would write an entry since it‚Äôs been a while. Work is chugging along. School is doing well. I got a C on my culture and diversity mid-term and an 93 or A in my animal office principles class. Psychology I‚Äôm not sure what my grade is. For school I had to volunteer 8 hours total for my animal office principles class. I chose a animal hospital in town called Hillcrest where I take my animals. It was an interesting experience to say the least. I split my time up into 2 4 hour shifts. The first time I went I was shadowing a vet tech named Tabitha who was mixed reminded me so much of my friend Tab who is also mixed. So me and Tabitha did the wards as they were called. We cleaned them out and put fresh water and litter. I also helped the lady who was doing grooming. She had a female collie that was freaking out because the lady was attempting to use electric clippers on the poor thing. She was freaking out so bad that she ended up drawing blood because the lady had her leashed to a cage so she wouldn‚Äôt get away and she was literally banging her head on the cage. So I sat in front of the collie and was stroking her head which calmed her down so the lady could get done grooming her. Well while I was helping the head doctor that was my supervisor walked in and I‚Äôm sure she thought I was just sitting there being lazy when I was actually helping because she made the comment ‚Äúthere is plenty to be done here.‚Äù 
I also folded up laundry, swept and mopped floors, washed dishes and cat boxes and changed the garbage bags. Tabitha kept commenting on how quick I was getting stuff done. I used to volunteer at a no-kill shelter in our town so I pretty much knew what to do but I‚Äôm sure to them it seemed like I was maybe lazy when the truth was I wasn‚Äôt sure how they did things compared to the no-kill shelter and I didn‚Äôt want to jump ahead and then get yelled at for doing it wrong. The second time was definitely more interesting. When I first came in the parking lot had one or two spaces left to park. 
So there was like 4 vet techs including Tabitha again so I followed her around but she kept getting called away to help with stuff so I kinda wandered around and just did stuff I remembered from the last time I was there. There was a pitbull who had to have a blood transfusion and the owner came to visit it. It‚Äôs name was ‚ÄúSexy‚Äù not sure if it was a male or female though. Well I was all the way across the room and I could hear its tail hitting the metal cage it was in which I thought was so cute. After a while it stopped doing that and when I walked by the owner was petting its head and it was falling asleep from it. There was also a cat that had AIDS and a puppy with Parvo. It was definitely a interesting experience and I‚Äôm assuming I didn‚Äôt do a horrible job because Tabitha asked if I was gonna come back and visit her lol. They were all very nice to me and I even saw the vet tech that helped show me and my mom how to soak Bear‚Äôs paws when he was alive. 
So other than that not much else going on. We are gonna be having mixed drink and chick flick movie night on the 21st of May. So hopefully that goes well. I think Buck is realizing that Bear is gone. He just seems so different lately. He has his hyper spunk but seems to have settled down a bit. I still miss him so much and it made it worse because in our animal office principles class we were talking about bereavement, grief and euthansia. So of course it got me thinking of Bear.

Title: bowling
Content: Well last night was our last night of bowling. It was interesting to say the least. We played one game to figure out if we were gonna move up to the top 8. The older lady on my team named Linda was like oh we won‚Äôt make it. Well boy was she wrong. We ended up making it to the top 8 so then she made the comment again oh that team is too good we‚Äôre gonna lose. We won that game which I scored a 186 and with handicap it was 270. I had a girl from the opposing team call me a ‚Äúsandbagger.‚Äù I had no clue what that meant so I wasn‚Äôt too worried about it. I asked one of my team members Linda‚Äôs husband Wayne what sandbagger meant. He told me it was someone that was basically faking that they sucked to get a high handicap which wasn‚Äôt me at all. I definitely don‚Äôt go around calling myself that good because I‚Äôm honestly not. Not as good as a LOT of the other teams. So anyway we went on to the next team to play and while I was playing that game one of the teammates of the girl that had called me a sandbagger came over and said that they wanted to talk to me. So I told my teammate Linda that maybe they wanted to beat me up. I was joking of course. So anyway I went over there and the lady said that she was just joking around and she didn‚Äôt appreciate Linda coming over and getting in her face and that she wasn‚Äôt gonna come back next season because of Linda. So I told Linda what the chick said and Linda was like that chick likes to start stuff and that she had told Linda it was none of her business which if you sit there and say a rude comment that everyone can hear then obviously it was her business lol. So anyway we ended up going against the first place team that the president was actually on. His son had some anger issues and his daughter was a loud mouth. YIKES. In the end we ended up winning. It was very interesting and freaky all at once. We went from 3rd from the bottom to first place all in one night lol. We are supposed to be getting some money back too so that will definitely be interesting to see how much money we get.

Title: A first for every thing
Content: Well I went to go pick Kacey up from school today and the principal and another lady came out with him holding a ice pack on his chin. The principal said that he had a issue in gym class and smacked his chin really good on the floor and that he would possibly need stitches. So me and my mom took him to the ER. The ER was actually pretty busy so it took a little while to be seen. When we finally got back in the room I got to see the wound for the first time it looked pretty bad. So of course they said they would have to do stitches. Everything was fine until Kacey saw the needle they were going to use to numb the area and he started freaking out. They wrapped him up like a taco and there was 2 nurses and the physician assistant who were helping to hold him down. After they stuck the needle in about 4 or 5 different places he was fine. Thank god I wasn‚Äôt squeamish because it looked quite painful especially the fact that they had to use a needle to go through his skin to put the thread through. EEEEWWWW. He gets the stitches out in 5 days so we‚Äôll see how it goes. So yea that was my interesting day. Nothing else of excitement going on. This Friday we are gonna have chick flick movie night/mixed drinks. Then Saturday I got my bowling league. I bowled this past Saturday by myself so hopefully they can find a team for me. My highest game was 157 without handicap lol. I‚Äôm still waiting to hear about the volunteering at Petco thing. Other than that not much else going on except school and work.

Title: Seriously considering it
Content:
Well today was just one of those sucky days where I wish I would have stayed in bed. I had to get up at the buttcrack of dawn OR at least to me it was to get Kacey off to school because Jess had to go into work super early. So then I went to work. Marjorie had to go to a doctor‚Äôs appointment and usually her appointments take about an hour or some times more so I did what I usually do and drove around so I didn‚Äôt have to sit in a boring waiting room. Well while driving around I noticed my phone was to the point that the battery meter was flashing but there was no bars and my car charger didn‚Äôt work so I had to go all the way home to put it on the charger. So I drove back out to the place to go see if she was ready to go. When I first pulled up I didn‚Äôt see her but then as I was going to come around again I saw her out there. 
So she gets in the car and is really mad saying that she has been ready since close to noon and that she has been trying to call me but for whatever reason it wasn‚Äôt going through. So then she said that she even called the office but they didn‚Äôt pick up and that she would be surprised if I didn‚Äôt get fired. Ok I admit it was my fault for the phone because I should have made sure it was charged before I left the house but it‚Äôs not my fault she couldn‚Äôt get my f*cking number right because I bet that‚Äôs what the issue was and I‚Äôm not a mind reader as to when she is ready to go and I‚Äôm not gonna sit in a germ infested waiting room for an hour. I would much rather go driving around and take pictures or something more productive. So I‚Äôm really considering quitting this job. I have held it for 3 years now and I‚Äôm just getting tired of this crap. I understand she is having issues with her memory and that is probably part of her anger but it seems like everything is my fault. Her being late for appointments is partly my fault but also it takes her like 10-15 minutes to even leave her house. 
So I‚Äôm really considering it but first would have to find another one. I‚Äôm gonna try to find one in the vet area if possible but keep this one until that happens. So sorry for the bit*hing just needed to get it out. Kacey‚Äôs stitches are doing well. I took pics and I‚Äôm gonna take a few more tomorrow so everyone can see how it has progressed.

Title: friend issue/drink night/Kacey
Content:
Well I have to rant about something that has been bugging me. I have a friend that has no job, lives with her mom, doesn‚Äôt drive. I try to include this friend in events that I‚Äôm doing like yesterday we had our mixed drink night at my house. I had asked this friend like a few weeks ago if she was interested in going. She told me I have no idea. So I thought ok maybe it was a lil too far out to figure out what she was doing. So I waited until Wednesday of this past week to ask if she happened to know whether she was coming or not she again told me I have no idea. This friend has done this to me quite a few times in the past. I understand that some people might have plans so that is why I ask a few weeks before we do a event or something so everyone knows and can make plans to attend. So this has got me thinking that either this person doesn‚Äôt want to come to the events or maybe that she doesn‚Äôt like me anymore and doesn‚Äôt have the guts to tell me this. I would honestly rather have someone tell me that they don‚Äôt want to hang out with me then every time I ask say i have no idea. This person did this same thing with a guy she was dating and he got tired of it and just started hanging out with his friends and not asking her because he figured that she would just say she didn‚Äôt know what she was doing or had no idea.
This friend has been there for me many times and I‚Äôm so grateful for that but I‚Äôm getting tired of asking her and getting the same answer of I have no idea. She also writes all the time I‚Äôm bored and needs to get out of the house but I have asked her if she wants to come over and she says no. So I‚Äôm guessing it‚Äôs not me she wants to keep her company which is fine everyone is allowed their opinion but I just hate feeling like this person doesn‚Äôt like me anymore and I don‚Äôt want to keep asking her and feel like I‚Äôm annoying her instead of being nice and offering because she‚Äôs my friend and I enjoy hanging out with her. 
So sorry about that. It has been bugging me and I just needed to get it out. So on to our mixed drink night. It went pretty good. My friends Ginny and Mandy from school came over. Ginny had her daughters Holly and Tara come over too. So we got pizza and the girls made their drinks and we played some games. It was really fun. I just hope they didn‚Äôt think we were too boring. 
As for Kacey he got his stitches out today. He did a very good job. I‚Äôm so happy they are out. He had a picnic at his school yesterday and he kept bugging me to let him go in this bouncy house thing but I was afraid to let him go because of his stitches. So he told me he was going to the bathroom which was inside near the bouncy house thing. So after a while I went to go check on him and found him in the line for the bouncy house so when I pulled him out of the line he threw a HUGE tantrum about it. Towards the end of the picnic I let him go in the bouncy house because there wasn‚Äôt that many kids in it. So that‚Äôs my entry for now.

Title: ok does this sound rude **EDIT**
Content:
I spoke with my nephew‚Äôs mom the other day. She called me to give me their new home number and she told me that C.J was going around telling everyone he was going to be in his brother Russ‚Äôs wedding and also my nephew‚Äôs mom was wondering why Russ didn‚Äôt like him so I sent this message to Russ‚Äôs finacee:
‚ÄúHey I just had a few questions for you. Is C.J. still invited to the wedding? Was wondering b.c he told Timmy‚Äôs mom that he was couldn‚Äôt get timmy for his b-day because he was going to be in Russ‚Äôs wedding . Also was curious why Timmy wasn‚Äôt invited to the wedding. From what his mom told me he talks about Russ all the time and actually talks about him, Jess and Shawn more than C.J. especially when Russ took him to the Y quite a while back when Russ still lived here. Well anyway I was just wonderin about those things.‚Äù
This is what his fiancee wrote back: ‚Äù   May 23 at 1:50pm
CJ is invited to the wedding but not IN the wedding. And Really, honestly, it is not really anybody‚Äôs business if we invite Timmy or not. Russ does not feel he is close to him‚Ä¶not from what he‚Äôs told me atleast and we make decisions together. Cj is getting an invite and like all wedding invites people send out, it will say CJ and Guest‚Ä¶.that will be up to him if and who he would bring as that guest. I dont like how that was questioned really‚Äìlike we are being TOLD who should be invited or not. 
I was just curious as to why Timmy wasn‚Äôt invited I don‚Äôt think I made it sound like I was telling them anything. Then she later sent this message to me:
‚Äù    May 23 at 7:42pm
You know, I was thinking more about these ‚Äúquestions‚Äù. Kinda rude. No more questions! This is an $11,000 wedding and we are inviting who WE want. I dont give a flying rats ass what anyones mom has said or how anyone feels about how ‚Äúclose‚Äù Russ is or isn‚Äôt with anyone. Russ isn‚Äôt too happy either with the tone of these questions Its just really no ones business except for when we go to someone ourselves and ask for advice or what have you. So, let this be the end please. All you guys really need to know is that Russ wants you three there the most, Jess knows what needs to be done for his role, and you and Kacey are included in everything. That is all you need to worry about. ‚Äú
and I wrote this back ‚ÄúI was just wondering about Timmy because he is a part of the family and I understand that Russ isn‚Äôt close with Timmy and I was just curious why he doesn‚Äôt like Timmy that much. I wasn‚Äôt trying to sound rude or anything. If it‚Äôs because Russ doesn‚Äôt like Louise or C.J. he shouldn‚Äôt take it out on Timmy. Plus if TImmy was able to come I think he could keep Kacey calm during the ceremony but I understand it‚Äôs your guy‚Äôs choice and I wasn‚Äôt trying to make it sound like I was ordering anyone to invite anyone. As for C.J I was curious because he was going around telling people he was IN the wedding and I wasn‚Äôt sure if he was still invited since you guys said that Marilyn and Neil weren‚Äôt. If C.J. wasn‚Äôt invited then I would let him know so that way he didn‚Äôt bother to make the 4 hour drive up there. So I‚Äôm sorry if you took it that I was being RUDE because I wasn‚Äôt trying to and I wasn‚Äôt trying to start anything either. 
Does my first message I wrote sound like I‚Äôm being bossy or rude? I don‚Äôt think it does and I was just curious why Russ didn‚Äôt like his nephew. He only pays attention to Kacey and I‚Äôm not ungrateful for that but I do wish he liked Timmy more. I honestly think it‚Äôs because of Timmy‚Äôs parents that Russ doesn‚Äôt like him and if that is the reason it‚Äôs a dumb one. With the way Kacey has been I‚Äôm not sure if we will be able to go to the ceremony because I‚Äôm not taking him so he can run around and not sit still and be loud. 
Well anyway I‚Äôll get off that subject before I get angry. I honestly don‚Äôt want to go but seeing as Russ‚Äôs side of family is already gonna be quite small compared to Jaime‚Äôs it makes me obligated to go plus it would be a opportunity for Kacey to see them and I know he loves Russ and Jaime. So I‚Äôm very torn on what to do besides the fact that they are having the wedding on Kacey‚Äôs BIRTHDAY. So we have to figure out when to have Kacey‚Äôs birthday. 
Ok well anyway not much else going on.It‚Äôs HOT here today. It‚Äôs 90 out. Crazy weather. 
**********************************EDIT**********************************
So I just checked my facebook and the fiancee wrote back to my previous message saying this: ‚Äù    May 23 at 8:52pm
When did either of us say Russ didnt like Timmy????????????? NEVER! And dont spread that!!! What the heck!?! Again- dont worry about anything its not your business really and we take it as you being pushy and nosey. And as for Kacey being calm during the ceremony, YOU need to keep him quiet!! Jessie will be up at the alter with us and it would be you who needs to keep him quiet. And we are having a videographer so he should not be talking, saying hi etc during church ceremony because we are having an audio video throughout, that does not come cheap. He is old enought to know the rule of when its time to be quiet! Or you will have to walk him out is all. Russ needs to call you and talk to you cuz I can not handle this, really. THis is gossipy stuff I dont get into. Again, you have NO IDEA what goes on to plan a wedding. And Russ asked and i quote, ‚Äúwhy in the world is it your duty to let CJ know not to drive here again, not your business or place.‚Äù Russ
spoke to CJ personally!‚Äù
Can we say B*TCH? As for Russ no he did not SAY he didn‚Äôt like Timmy but he doesn‚Äôt have to. It‚Äôs his actions that prove that he doesn‚Äôt like Timmy. When has he spent time with Timmy or brought him gifts? NEVER. He doesn‚Äôt ask about Timmy or really seem to want anything to do with him. The comment about me having to keep Kacey quiet during the ceremony that was RUDE. Yea he‚Äôs old enough to know to be quiet but ADHD kids have a tough time doing it. It would have nothing to do with me keeping him quiet. What does what I‚Äôm talking about have to do with the cost of a wedding? I was just asking why Timmy wasn‚Äôt invited and making C.J. was actually invited and that he wasn‚Äôt thinking he was invited when he wasn‚Äôt. C.J. is a bit slow sometimes lol. As for the comment about letting C.J. know about not driving up there if he wasn‚Äôt invited we both know that if they tried to call Russ he would probably not answer the phone because he would assume it‚Äôs his mom trying to call. This just makes me not want to go to the wedding even more. Maybe we‚Äôll just stay at the hotel and go swimming instead of going to the ceremony. Pools sound better than a wedding anyway unless it‚Äôs my own wedding.
This makes me think of our wedding and the fact that I will never be a b*tch to anyone. I understand that planning a wedding is hard and stressful not to mention expensive but there is ways to get around spending a sh*tload of money on a wedding. It‚Äôs all in who yout know if you ask me. For me I don‚Äôt need a huge overpriced wedding but I also don‚Äôt want a courthouse wedding either. I just want a nice one that is reasonably priced and not too cheap but not too expensive either. That‚Äôs why I have been waiting to get married not because I‚Äôm afraid of commitment like all the foreigners think lol but because I want a nice wedding and to be free of debt and start fresh. I also understand that my friends and family aren‚Äôt made of money and as long as whatever they picked was a certain color and not stained then they can pick whatever they would like. Jess has a lot of connections through Logli‚Äôs probably the only good thing he got out of that place lol so I‚Äôm sure we can find a good deal on flowers and location. I could maybe have my friend Tab do the pictures if she would like if not I could try to find someone else that enjoyed photography and took good pictures.

Title: Had time to think
Content:
I started thinking about the whole convo with Jaime yesterday. She had written that it was none of my business regarding Timmy or C.J. so why didn‚Äôt she just say that to me and had that be the end of it. Why did she rub the fact that their wedding cost 11,000 or had the nerve to comment on Kacey. They have had Kacey spend almost a week with them so they both know how Kacey acts and this was even before he was put on meds. Besides the fact he is ADHD it doesn‚Äôt matter how old he is he is still not gonna be able to sit still and be quiet. That‚Äôs part of his disorder I guess you can call it. That pissed me off though. When Jess came home I was telling him about it and he didn‚Äôt even seem to care. 
Typical man when it comes to women bickering they could care less. Russ never did call me so I guess he wasn‚Äôt that worried about it. Hopefully we have no more drama until the wedding. Now I know better than to ask any questions and I‚Äôll just assume shit and then when they bitch at me and say why didn‚Äôt you ask then I can say well I didn‚Äôt want to be called ‚Äúrude‚Äù for asking a simple fucking question. To me it just seems like they think we are fucking stupid more me than Jesse obviously. It drives me crazy. I‚Äôm not a moron and don‚Äôt appreciate being treated like one. I‚Äôm so tempted to take Kacey to the ceremony just to ruin their videotaping. Give him shitloads of candy and just let him fucking run wild for the fun of it. To me I don‚Äôt know if I want my son to be near these fucking people anymore. The only thing Russ was good for was giving him expensive presents. He barely ever sees him or does anything with him anyway and Jaime was a cool chick but now I think I see her true colors coming out and that she is basically like all the pretty people and so damn concerned about rubbing the fact that they make good money and that nobody is good enough for them. I don‚Äôt need that crap in my life. If Jess wants to be associated with them he can be by himself. 
2 out of the 3 people that commented said she was wrong for how she said things. I‚Äôll admit I can be nosy but pushy I don‚Äôt think I am and for this part I don‚Äôt think asking a simple question about why someone wasn‚Äôt invited was that nosy. But whatever I‚Äôll think of some evil thing. If there is one thing I can‚Äôt stand is someone trying to tell me what to do with my son. That is one thing I don‚Äôt tolerate especially from someone who doesn‚Äôt even know my son that well. Yea she may have been with Russ for a year or two or however long but they barely see Kacey and probably think that I don‚Äôt know how to disclipine him and let him run wild. All my friends that have actually SPENT time with me and him know I get on his ass about stuff left and right and to some people they probably think I‚Äôm too strict with him. I make him use manners and I get on him when he‚Äôs bugging people. Most of the people are like ‚Äúoh he‚Äôs fine‚Äù but I still get on him.

Title: The phone call
Content:
Well today after I got off of work Russ called me.I was thinking oh sh*t here we go. He was complaining about stuff and I started talking about the whole Kacey thing and actually started partially crying about it. He handed the phone to Jaime and we were talking about the different issues. She said she kept talking instead of saying it was none of my business because she had to explain herself which is what I did and got basically told i was rude for it. Then we were discussing the Kacey deal and I said that it made me feel like she was saying I was a bad mom to which she apologized. In the end I think we got things worked out. 
So hopefully there will be no more drama. The whole thing about Timmy came down to the fact that if Louise wants Russ to spend more time with Timmy she needs to contact him and talk to him about it according to Jaime. It does make sense because Louise seems to expect Russ to contact her all the time but when has she ever contacted them and tried to set something up. 
So glad that is over and hopefully everything goes ok and no one has drama.
